actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the tax-exempt treatment allowed to certain industrial development bonds to bonds the proceeds of which are to be used within economically distressed cities, and to allow national banks to underwrite these bonds.
short_title: Economically Distressed Cities Revenue Bond Act

summary.text: Economically Distressed Cities Revenue Bond Act - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to increase from $5,000,000 to $50,000,000 the investment ceiling on tax-exempt industrial development bonds for any city whose population exceeds 100,000, if such city has had an unemployment rate of 6.5 percent or greater for any three of the preceeding 12 months.

titles.title: Economically Distressed Cities Revenue Bond Act

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow the tax-exempt treatment allowed to certain industrial development bonds to bonds the proceeds of which are to be used within economically distressed cities, and to allow national banks to underwrite these bonds.
